abbrkey.#: word boundary (see Chapter~{chap:thelexicaltonesofnouns}); by extension: the boundary of the entire expression to which a~tone pattern is associated (see Chapters~{chap:compoundnouns}-{chap:verbsandtheircombinatoryproperties})
abbrkey.$‡${}\\ipa{ʐwæ˧}: incorrect (ungrammatical) form; note that the asterisk is not used, to preclude confusion with reconstructed forms
abbrkey.--: morpheme break, used in the representation of the tone pattern of an expression made up of two (or more) morphemes. Thus, for a dimorphemic compound noun, --L refers to a~L tone that attaches after the morpheme break (i.e. on the second noun: the head noun), and LM--L indicates that the first noun gets LM tone and the second gets L. (In earlier publications on Yongning Na, the symbol used was a~superscript circle~$^{°}$, but this use of the symbol conflicted headlong with Africanist usage, in which L$^{°}$ refers to a~level L tone: a~tone that contrasts with L through the absence of a~phonetic falling contour.)
abbrkey.//\\ipa{ʐwæ˥}//: underlying phonological form (a~vertical bar is more usual, but in this volume the vertical bar is used for tone group boundaries)
abbrkey.::: phonological correspondence between two languages or dialects (a~standard convention in historical linguistics)
abbrkey.AccompPfv: Verbs illustrating the various tone categories, in the frame accomplished+verb+perfective
abbrkey.Agriculture: Agriculture: agricultural activities over the course of the year
abbrkey.BuriedAlive: Buried alive: how a young woman ran into great trouble because of her greed
abbrkey.Caravans: Caravans: about the trade which flourished in the area in the second quarter of the twentieth century
abbrkey.ComingOfAge: Coming of age: the ritual performed at age thirteen
abbrkey.CoordCompounds2: Coordinative compounds, 2: pairs of numerals in association with ‘year', ‘month' or ‘day'
abbrkey.DetermCompounds11: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 11 (a few verifications)
abbrkey.DetermCompounds12: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 12
abbrkey.DetermCompounds13: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 13 (compounds with the noun ‘sheep')
abbrkey.DetermCompounds14: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 14
abbrkey.DetermCompounds15: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 15 (a few compounds with the noun ‘cat')
abbrkey.DetermCompounds16: The tones of compound nouns: cultural objects and peoples
abbrkey.DetermCompounds1to4: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, documents 1 to 4
abbrkey.DetermCompounds5: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 5 (verifications)
abbrkey.DetermCompounds6: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 6 (verifications)
abbrkey.DetermCompounds7: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 7 (extensive set)
abbrkey.DetermCompounds8to10: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, documents 8 to 10 (complements)
abbrkey.Dog: Dog: how dog and man exchanged their lifespans
abbrkey.F: focalization of the word that precedes (through local intonational modification of tone: see~Section sec:focalization)
abbrkey.F0: fundamental frequency (a standard abbreviation in phonetics)
abbrkey.F1, F2{...}: Female language consultant number 1, 2{...} (this is a~standard convention in phonetics; the numbering is chronological, referring to the set of Naish recordings that have been collected since 2002)
abbrkey.FoodShortage: Food shortage: how parents set out to sell children, and then changed their mind
abbrkey.Funeral: Funeral: how funeral rites used to be conducted
abbrkey.Healing: Healing: how diseases used to be treated through rituals
abbrkey.Housebuilding: Housebuilding: the process of building a house
abbrkey.Lake: Lake: how the Lake was created
abbrkey.LocativePostp: Nouns followed by locative (spatial) postpositions: ‘beside', ‘behind', ‘to the left', ‘to the right'
abbrkey.Mountains: Mountains: some beliefs associated to the mountains around Yongning
abbrkey.Mushrooms: Mushrooms: which ones are collected for cooking and for medicine
abbrkey.NounsInFrame: Disyllabic nouns placed in a carrier sentence: ‘This is (a/the) N', in order to bring out their tone patterns
abbrkey.NumClf (41 documents): The titles of all 41 documents follow
abbrkey.ObjectVerb: Data illustrating the tone patterns of object-plus-verb combinations, 1
abbrkey.ObjectVerb2: Data illustrating the tone patterns of object-plus-verb combinations, 2
abbrkey.ObjectVerb3: Data illustrating the tone patterns of object-plus-verb combinations, 3
abbrkey.PalatalizedApicalized: Words illustrating the opposition between two apicalized high front vowels following alveolo-palatal initials
abbrkey.PossessPro: Possessive constructions with pronouns, without an intervening particle
abbrkey.Renaming: Renaming: how one used to change a child's name
abbrkey.Reward: Reward: how the heavens rewarded an honest man
abbrkey.Seeds: Seeds: ﻿how mankind obtained seeds and learnt to grow crops
abbrkey.SpatialOrientation: Spatial orientation: combinations among verbs and prefixes (or adverbials) indicating spatial orientation
abbrkey.SubjectVerb: Data illustrating the tone patterns of subject-plus-verb combinations
abbrkey.Tiger: Tiger: how the tiger attacked a woman and her daughter
abbrkey.TraderAndHisSon: Trader and his son: how a trader taught his son how to handle the ups and downs of commerce
abbrkey.VerbDurative: Verbs illustrating the various tone categories, in the frame durative+V+progressive
abbrkey.VerbProhib: Verbs of all tone categories preceded by the
abbrkey.VerbProhib2: Verbs of all tone categories preceded by the prohibitive, 2
abbrkey.VerbReduplObj: Reduplicated verbs (tones: M, H, L and MH) preceded by an object
abbrkey.VerbReduplObj2: Reduplicated verbs of all tone categories preceded by an object
abbrkey.\\$: a symbol used in H\$, one of the lexical categories of H tones
abbrkey.\\ipa{↑}: emphatic stress on syllable that follows (see~Section sec:emphaticstressanditstoneddownavatars)
abbrkey.\\ipa{≈}: free variation: variation that is not conditioned by phonological or morphosyntactic parameters (example: [\ipa{tɕɥe}]{}\ipa{≈}{}[\ipa{tɕɥi}]). In this volume, the tilde $~$, commonly used in linguistics as a~symbol for free variation, is reserved for reduplication.
abbrkey.certitude: a use of the copula described by Lidz (2010:497) as ``an epistemic strategy that marks a high degree of certitude"
abbrkey.cs: centisecond: a~unit of time equal to 0.01 seconds
abbrkey.†\\ipa{ʐwæ˧}: a form that is predicted on the basis of regular rules, but unattested

label: mv̩˧ʁo˥\$ dze˩a -hĩ˥ -dʑo˥ kɤ˩-nɑ˧mi˧ di˧qo˧ se˥ -dʑo˥ ə˧v̩˧˥
trs: As the Eagle is greatest of all that fly in the sky, so the Uncle is greatest of all that walk the earth.
